summary: This is a grand jury subpoena issued to Ghislaine Maxwell by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, commanding her to appear on July 24, 2020, and produce foreign financial account records (FBAR-related documents) for the past five years. The subpoena relates to alleged violations of foreign bank account reporting laws.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The document is a grand jury subpoena addressed to her, commanding her appearance and production of foreign financial account records.

persons.name: Christian Everdell
persons.context: The subpoena is addressed to Ghislaine Maxwell in care of Christian Everdell, Esq., indicating he is likely her attorney.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: Signed the subpoena as the Acting United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

connections.description: The subpoena is addressed to Maxwell in care of Everdell, indicating he is her attorney of record.
Strauss, as Acting U.S. Attorney, is the prosecuting authority issuing the subpoena to Maxwell.

events.title: Grand Jury Appearance Subpoena
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell is commanded to appear before a federal grand jury in the Southern District of New York to testify and produce foreign financial account records.

events.title: Subpoena Issuance
events.description: The grand jury subpoena is signed and issued by Acting U.S. Attorney Audrey Strauss.

locations: United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Manhattan, New York, New York
One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: A federal grand jury subpoena was issued to Ghislaine Maxwell in July 2020, commanding her appearance and production of foreign financial account records.
The subpoena relates to alleged violations of foreign bank account reporting laws (31 U.S.C. §§ 5314, 5322 and related regulations).
Maxwell was required to produce FBAR-related records for foreign financial accounts she had an interest in or authority over for the past five years.
The subpoena indicates an active financial investigation into Maxwell's foreign accounts separate from other charges she faced.
